Name: All Catfish Species Inventory [1]
Collection: information collated by genera, including estimated numbers of species, taxonomic experts

Name: Arctos [2]
Focus: Specimen holdings of several natural history museums, agencies, and accessible private collections
Collection: Vertebrates, invertebrates, parasites, vascular and non-vascular plants, many with images and extensive usage data.

Name: AntWeb [3]
Collection: Specimen information, collection details, photographs, higher taxonomy

Name: Avibase - the World Bird Database [4]
Collection: Avibase is an extensive database information system about all birds of the world, containing over 27 million records about 10,000 species and 22,000 subspecies of birds, including distribution information for 20,000 regions, taxonomy, synonyms in several languages and more.

Name: ASEAN Biodiversity Information Sharing Service (BISS) [5]
Focus: Amphibians, birds, butterflies, dragonflies, edible plants, freshwater fishes, mammals, plants, reptiles and Malesian mosses of Southeast Asia
Collection: IUCN status, habitat, regional presence/absence, description, classification

Name: BioLib - Biological Library  [6]
Focus: BioLib is an international encyclopedia of plants, fungi and animals.
Collection: Apart from taxonomic system you can visit the gallery, glossary, vernacular names dictionary, database of links and literature, systems of biotopes, discussion forum and several other functions related to biology.

Name: CITES species database [7]
Focus: All species ever listed in CITES Appendices I, II or III
Collection: Scientific names, higher taxonomy, distribution, photos and CITES quotas

Name: Fauna Europaea [8]
Collection: Quality-checked data, 180,712 accepted taxon names, web portal also provide links to other key biodiversity services.

Name: FishBase [9]
Collection: Higher taxonomy, common names, distribution, IUCN Redlist status

Name: FLOW: Fulgoromorpha Lists On the Web]  [10]
Collection: Taxonomy and classification, nomenclature, type depository, bibliography, distribution, photos on actual and fossil planthoppers of the world and various associated biological information (host-plants, parasites, trophobiosis, etc.).

Name: Freshwater Ecoregions of the World (FEOW) [11]
Collection: Maps of species and endemic numbers.

Name: HerpNET [12]
Collection: Amphibian and reptile distributions.

Name: WBPBDIVDB
Focus: A Database of  Plant Biodiversity of West Bengal
Collection: richness of floral diversity of West Bengal from  Terai, Duars, Darjeeling, the eastern Himalayan region and in the mangrove forests of Sundarbans.

Name: Reptile Database
Collection: Taxonomic information, names, photos

Name: iNaturalist
Collection: Geolocated observations, location checklists, taxonomic information, range maps

Name: Integrated Botanical Information System (IBIS) [13]
Collection: Taxonomic information, collection details, photographs

Name: iSpot
Focus: All forms of life large enough to photograph
Collection: Geolocated individual observations and other information produced by citizen science participants

Name: Integrated Taxonomic Information System (ITIS) [14]
Focus: all taxa of interest to North America, with other taxa included as available
Collection: Taxonomic information, including higher taxonomy

Name: Natural History Information System [15]
Focus: all forms of life, biotopes, rocks
Collection: Faunistic and floristic records (citizen science and other sources), phenology, ecology, biotopes, taxonomy, paleontology, stratigraphy

Name: NatureServe [16]
Focus: plants, animals, and ecosystems of the United States and Canada
Collection: Source for information on more than 70,000 plants, animals, and ecosystems of the United States and Canada, including rare and endangered species.

Name: Pl@ntNet
Collection: Plant identification, observations, citizen science project, photographs, distribution

Name: WikiSpecies [17]
Collection: Higher taxonomy, synonyms, vernacular names, references

Name: A Pan-European Species-directories Infrastructure (PESI) [18]
Collection: Authoritative taxonomic checklist of European species, including higher taxonomy, synonyms, vernacular names and European distribution

Name: Naturdata [19]
Collection: Checklist of Portuguese species including mainland and islands with a page for each species including taxonomy, synonyms, vernacular names, images, videos and Portuguese distribution

Name: Georgia (country) biodiversity website [20]
Collection: Checklists covering ca. 11,000 of plants and animals recorded for Georgia (Central and Western Caucasus)

Name: ScaleNet [21]
Collection: Nomenclature, distribution, hosts, systematics, references

Name: BacDive
Focus: Metadatabase that provides strain-linked information about bacterial and archaeal biodiversity.
Collection: Different kind of metadata like taxonomy, morphology, physiology, environment and molecular-biology.

Name: World Register of Marine Species
Collection: Higher taxonomy, scientific names, synonyms, distribution, attributes, references

Name: AlgaeBase
Focus: Algae and other oxygenic photosynthesisers other than embryophyte land plants
Collection: Higher taxonomy, scientific names, common names, images, distribution, references

Name: Tropicos [22]
Focus: Taxonomy, distribution, and specimen data for Missouri Botanical Garden.
Collection: Nearly 1.3 million scientific names and over 4.4 million specimen records, accumulated during the past 30 years.

Name: iAMF[23][24]
Focus: Arbuscular Mycorrhizal Fungi Database for Phylogeny, Nomenclature, Taxonomy and Distribution in India
Collection: Distribution, phylogeny and taxonomy database of arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi was built in two phases: In the first phase of the study (2013-2015) occurrence of about 148 species of AM fungi was reported across 18 states of India namely: Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Bihar, Goa, Haryana, Jammu and Kashmir, Karnataka, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Meghalaya, Orissa, Punjab, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, Uttarkhand, Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal (Gupta et al. 2014, under Delhi University innovation project) . In the second phase under UGC project (2015 onwards) the study has been extended to three more states namely Delhi, Tripura and Manipur reporting occurrence of 161 species. rRNA sequence data for these fungi is added as Phylogenetic Map and distribution data is available as Google Map.
